title: Understanding Kai'Sa's Nerf
body:
https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xQ2BiNoFAL8/W8TxoNYhoAI/AAAAAAABJFw/jdGjIa38YSQKoZlVd03Sl24tMVMPGF3uACLcBGAs/s640/kaisapassive2.jpg

Someone else recently shared this because they were confused by this, and I'll admit it is kind of confusing in the way that it is worded on [Surrenderat20](https://www.surrenderat20.net/2018/10/1015-pbe-update-tentative-balance.html)

I think I explained it in a way that made sense to them so they decided to delete their post, which is unfortunate because it would have been good for others to see if they were also confused. 

Basically, her passive is no longer an execute in the sense that the total damage dealt is no longer equal to a percentage target's missing health. Instead, detonating 4 stacks of plasma now deals a flat amount of damage, regardless of the enemy's total health, that increases significantly based on the percentage of the target's missing health. 

So it is weaker against tanks. 

I think this is a good nerf.

However, when you consider that tanks most likely have more health, it takes her longer to get them to a greater % of missing health because her bonus damage burns through a lower percentage of their overall health. 

They don't necessarily need to have a significant amount of MR or damage reducing effects, they just need more health. Currently, having more health isn't helpful. Changing this was their goal. 

Of course MR and damage reduction is still going to be useful, probably even better now, and that is good.

I want to try and put it in a different way. If we have Kai'Sa proc her passive on different targets while she has the exact same stats and while they have the exact same percentage of total health, she will deal the same amount of damage (pre-mitigation) regardless of their total health. 

So not only will it take her longer to scale her damage output up on enemies with larger health totals, but it she will not deal as much damage in respect to the target's total health. 

The live passive will take longer to build against champions with a larger total health, but it would build to a point where it would deal more damage than it would against a champion with a smaller total health.

I don't really like this change going through since there are few ADCs in the game with easy tank shred except for {{champion:67}} and {{champion:96}}. The lesser tank busters are {{champion:202}} {{champion:110}} and {{champion:203}}. Other than those the only decent option for tank busting is an ADC who has good kiting that can slot in {{item:3153}} in their build like {{champion:22}} or {{champion:429}}. These last ones aren't as strong as {{champion:67}} or {{champion:96}}. Having {{champion:145}} as a tank buster isn't bad in premise, the main issue lies in how easy it is for her to stack up her passive on targets, yes it is a 5 stack passive vs Vayne's 3 but with {{item:3085}} she can stack it on 3 targets at once, and her teammates can also stack it with their CC, leading to high CC comps having massive amounts of damage through {{champion:145}} . 

I'd like to see them change {{champion:145}} passive so that it's closer to {{champion:201}} before they do something like this. Basically I think it might be a good idea to make it so that ally immobilizing effects will only stack plasma on targets if {{champion:145}} already put one on them, like how ally AAs only stack {{champion:201}} passive after he applies the first stack. This would hurt her damage in fights since wombo engages like a {{champion:54}} + {{champion:61}} or a good engage by {{champion:12}} or {{champion:497}} won't prime the enemy team with 3-4 stacks of plasma for {{champion:145}} to instantly pop. It would also hurt her mobility, another thing people complain about since she would need to use W to make picks with her R or use it defensively for the shield or on fleeing targets she's already had a chance to AA. That way she can still function as a high damage hybrid carry without being as oppressive due to ally's providing indirect damage buffs to her
